paper_metadata.title: The Effects of Exiting from Poverty Alleviation Program on Economic Growth: Evidence from China

program_information.program_name: China's National Poverty Alleviation Program (Third Wave)

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The targeted counties comfort with transfer payments and preferential development policies

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: the economic and social development of previous poverty counties have a significant slowdown after they exited from the poverty alleviation program... fixed investments in pre-poverty counties fall... Grain production has declined... residents' savings significantly decrease... public revenues and public expenditures significantly decrease
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: the difference-in-differences approach is applied to evaluate the impacts of withdrawing from the program for the previous national poverty counties

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: It is also called the third wave of China's poverty alleviation program. It covers 592 counties and contains over 60% poverty-stricken population in China
evidence_citations.country_citation: Over the past twenty years, China has made great achievements in the process of antipoverty
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The targets of the program are also known as national poverty counties
